div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_animated et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_text_align_left

div.p:
Breakfast and Lunch will be provided for all children under the age of 18 at the following locations:
Clarksville Elementary
Chase City Elementary
LaCrosse Elementary
South Hill Elementary
– Pick up times will be 11 am – 12:30 pm. Lunch for the day will be picked up drive thru style, along with breakfast for the next morning.
– Please call your order in or fill out the form OR call in by 8:30 am so we can prepare enough meals.
– The meal hotline number is 434-533-9060. Follow the prompts and leave a message with the date, pick up location and number of meals.
**Please Note UPDATED** Children do not need to be present at pick up to receive food. Please be able to provide the name and school that each student attends.

Updated Information – March 25, 2020 10:40 am
Schools will be closed the remainder of the academic year. We will continue to update through our website, Social Media and School Messenger.
Due to the outbreak of COVID-19, MCPS had Guest Wifi Networks set up at all 8 school locations and Central Office.

div.p:
Committed to Our Mission:
Preparing All Students for Success

div.class: et_pb_slide et_pb_slide_2 et_pb_section_parallax et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_media_alignment_center et_pb_slider_with_text_overlay

div.div: Mecklenburg County Public Schools provide a 21st century learning environment which fosters career literacy, academic enhancement, social-emotional growth and community engagement that prepares students who contribute to the global society.

div.class: et_pb_slide et_pb_slide_3 et_pb_section_parallax et_pb_bg_layout_dark et_pb_media_alignment_center et_pb_slider_with_text_overlay

div.div: The mission of the Mecklenburg Public School Division, in partnership with family and community, is to provide all students with a quality education within a safe environment supporting the development of intellectual growth, effective communication, wellness, and life-long learning in a rapidly changing society.

h2.a: Longwood University Talented and Gifted Summer Program

div.p: The Longwood University College of Education & Human Services would like to invite your Talented and Gifted (TAG) students to participate in the Longwood University Talented and Gifted two week summer program. For more information about the program, visit this...

div.p: Friday, March 27, 2020 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM- Leggett Auditorium Sentara Halifax Regional Hospital 2204 Wilborn Avenue, South Boston The course is designed to teach you how to help someone who is developing a mental health problem or experiencing a mental health crisis....
